info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 1:28PM CDT until August 31 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria and Harris.
* WHEN...Until 315 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 128 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pasadena, northern Pearland, Deer Park, South Houston, Bellaire, West University Place, Galena Park, Jacinto City, Second Ward, Greater Eastwood, Greater Fifth Ward, Greater Hobby Area, Cloverleaf, Greater Third Ward, Downtown Houston, Macgregor, Midtown Houston, northern South Belt / Ellington, Near Northside Houston and Fourth Ward. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
